etymologies: mid 19th century. From German Ryakolith from ancient Greek ῥυακ-, ῥύαξ mountain-stream, lava-stream (from the base of ῥεῖν to flow + -αξ, suffix forming nouns) + German -o- + -lith, with remodelling of the ending after -lite

definitions: A feldspar occurring chiefly as white or colourless crystals in volcanic rocks, subsequently identified with sanidine.
